item.title: John Stuart Mill on Free Speech
item.description: On the next stream we’re taking a look at John Stuart Mill’s arguments for freedom of speech in chapter 2 of On Liberty: On the Liberty of Thought and Discussion. In particular, we’ll take a look at the idea of the marketplace of ideas. We’re going to cover three different interpretations of Mill’s arguments: Absolutist: Any interference with an agent’s freedom of speech (properly understood) counts as a violation of liberty rights.
